column1: Insertion and/or deletion at the beginning of the head is O(1) //only the head pointer needs to be updated
Insertion and/or deletion at the end (tail) is a O(n) due to the fact you need to traverse through the entire linked list to find the second to last node
Linked lists are linked due to the fact they have pointers connecting them all together
node is a space of contiguous memory
column2: the building block of a linked list
